actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with amendments favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Murkowski with amendments. With written report No. 106-208.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 364.
Passed Senate with amendments by Unanimous Consent.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on National Parks, Historic Preservation and Recreation
Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands

official_title: A bill to direct the Secretary of the Interior to conduct special resource studies to determine the national significance of specific sites as well as the suitability and feasibility of their inclusion as units of the National Park System.
short_title: National Park System New Area Study Act of 2000
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: National Park System New Area Study Act of 2000 - Requires the Secretary of the Interior, acting through the Director of the National Park Service, to report to certain congressional committees on the findings, conclusions, and recommendations of studies of specified sites and areas for potential inclusion in the National Park System.Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: National Park System New Area Study Act of 2000
National Park System New Area Study Act of 2000
National Park System New Area Study Act of 2000

A bill to direct the Secretary of the Interior to conduct special resource studies to determine the national significance of specific sites as well as the suitability and feasibility of their inclusion as units of the National Park System.
